name: Comic Book Characters with Disabilities Online Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: In 1941 DC Comics introduces a surgeon who loses his sight in a grenade blast.  He discovers he can now only "see" in total darkness.  He dons a costume and cape and eventually becomes a member of the Justice Society.  Who is he?
options: Pa Hunkle aka the Red Tornado
questions.explanation:
Charles McNider aka Dr. Mid-Nite

	Dr. Mid-Nite uses special goggles to overcome his blindness during daylight.  Over the years there have been other characters that would assume the mantle of Dr. Mid-Nite.

questions.text: In 1941 Fawcett Comics introduced a young boy with a lame left leg who required a crutch to walk.  This boy would go on to become a side-kick to their popular Captain Marvel character.  Who is he?
questions.correct: Freddy Freeman aka Captain Marvel Jr.
options: Bill Hill Batson aka Lieutenant Marvel
Pinkerton Butler aka Pinky the Whiz Kid
questions.explanation:
Freddy Freeman aka Captain Marvel Jr.

	As Freddy, his leg would remain without full function, but when he uttered "Captain Marvel" he would be turned into a super powered teen with full use of both legs.

questions.text: In 1961 Marvel Comics introduced a young blind woman to the cast of the 'Fantastic Four' series.  She would become the girlfriend of the Thing.  What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Alicia Masters.

	Alicia is the daughter of the Fantastic Four foe, the Puppet Master.  She is also a world renowned sculptress.

questions.text: In 1963, three months before Marvel introduced Professor Xavier, DC Comics introduced their own wheelchair bound paraplegic who also led a team of misfit heroes.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Niles Caulder.

	Niles was referred to as "Chief" and he was the leader of the Doom Patrol, whose members consisted of Negative Man, Elasti-Girl and Robotman.

questions.text: In 1964 Marvel Comics first published their "man without fear".  Blinded as a child, and exposed to radioactive material that heightened his remaining senses.  Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Daredevil.

	Matt Murdock, aka Daredevil, originally becomes a superhero in order to obtain revenge against his father's killers.  The character would become popular enough to lead to his presence in both TV and film.

questions.text: Marvel Comics created the Canadian superhero group known as Alpha Flight in 1979.  One of their members is a dwarf with enhanced strength and acrobatic abilities.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Puck.

	Eugene Judd was a bouncer before joining Alpha Flight.  Originally he was 6'6" tall, but ancient mysticism shrunk him to his familiar 3'6" size.  It also endowed him with immortality.

questions.text: In 1984, the Teen Titans added a mute member to their team.  The son of their arch enemy, Deathstroke the Terminator.  What is his name?
questions.explanation:
Jericho.

	Joseph Wilson, aka Jericho, would be depicted without thought bubbles to further enhance his being mute for the readers.  He was shown using American Sign Language.

questions.text: This X-men member is one of the few superheroes depicted with having a learning disability.  Able to shoot plasmoids from her hands (that she refers to as "fireworks"), this hero suffers from dyscalculia.  Who is she?
questions.explanation:
Jubilee.

	Jubilee was created in 1989.  Dyscalculia is a mental disability that makes solving math related problems extremely difficult.

questions.text: Barbara Gordon spent years as the Batman sidekick known as Batgirl.  In 1988 she was shot by the Joker and became a paraplegic.  Eventually from her wheelchair, she would become known by another hero name.  What is it?
questions.explanation:
Oracle.

	Oracle would be the central internet and electronic based hero for all the DC Universe.  She would lead the female-centric group known as The Birds of Prey.

questions.text: First appearing in 1998, this Marvel hero is one of the first to have cerebral palsy.  It was most noticeable in his atrophied right arm.  Using a suit of armor, he was a member of the Slingers.  What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Hornet.

	Eddie McDonough would be one of four Marvel characters to use the identity of Hornet. His character was eventually killed off in a battle against HYDRA.
